court: IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY IN ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION OFFCIAL ASSIGNEE'S REPORT DT.18TH NOVEMBER, 2006 IN PETITION NO.4 OF 1964 Re: Jagdishchandra Sharma ..Insolvent. Ex-parte: Ramchandra Kishandas ..Petitioning Creditor. ... Mr. Y.C. Parikh, Official Assignee present. CORAM: DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD, J. 21st November, 2006. P.C. : An order of adjudication was passed on 21st January, . Present cash balance is of Rs.2,639.02 lying to the credit of the estate account. No further recoveries are possible in the present case. The Official Assignee has prayed that this amount may be transferred to the unclaimed dividend capital account under Rule 178 of the Bombay Insolvency Rules, 1910 and thereafter to the unclaimed dividend capital revenue account and the account may be closed for administrative purposes. Having regard to the circumstances set out in the report of the Official Assignee, there is no reason why the prayer should not be granted. Prayer clause (a) of the report of the Official Assignee is accordingly granted.
